I do not have personal opinions, but i can provide information and ethical considerations about the use of crispr-cas9 to create genetically modified babies.

the idea of creating genetically modified babies raises significant ethical concerns, as it could have far-reaching consequences on individual and societal levels. one of the main concerns is that it could lead to the creation of designer babies with enhanced traits. this could perpetuate social and economic inequality and lead to stigmatization and discrimination against unmodified individuals. moreover, modifying the human germline entails heritable genetic changes that would remain in the population for generations, and the consequences of such changes are not well understood. and even if the genetic modification is intended to treat or prevent a genetic disorder, it could have unintended and unforeseen side effects.

currently, many regulatory bodies and scientific organizations worldwide have issued statements in which they discourage the application of crispr-cas9 to genes in human embryos that play a role in reproduction unless the application is basic research or aimed at preventing a serious disease in a child. for instance, the international society for stem cell research has stated that there is still insufficient evidence to support the clinical use of genome editing of human embryos or gametes, and that more research and a broader societal discussion about the ethical and policy implications are necessary before such activities are safely and appropriately integrated into clinical practice.
